page.title: 08AMENITIES,DUNVANT
page.content: {Community Centre.}The original wooden building was built by unemployed men of the area,under the auspices of the South Wales School of Social Services, during the depression in the 1930's. This building was destroyed by fire and replaced by a modern structure in 1977.The new Centre offers more facilities and is used by several local organisations including the Women's Institute,karate and dance clubs.Badminton is played in the main hall which also has a large stage on which plays and pantomimes are performed by local groups. {Clyne Valley Country Park.}This newly established park enables the people of Dunvant and Killay to enjoy a pleasant tree-lined walk to Swansea Bay,three miles away.The path,for cyclists and pedestrians,is built on the route of the railway line which closed in 1962.
